meta.name: description
meta.content: Hartford Public Schools serve K-12th grade students and is located in Hartford, MI.

div.p:
The Hartford Public School District is seeking applicants for the current vacancy on the Board of Education. An individual will be appointed to fill the position through Dec 31, 2020 and will be replaced by the individual elected to the position (based upon the Nov 3, 2020 election results) on Jan 1, 2021.
Interested persons must submit a letter expressing interest with their qualifications for the seat to the District Central Office no later than 2 p.m. on May 4, 2020.
If you have any questions concerning the role of the board of education and the responsibilities of a board member, please contact Andrew Hubbard, Superintendent of Schools, at hubbarda@hpsmi.org or 269-621-7001.

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 1850px; height: 843px;

h3.a: Board of Education Work Study Meeting - HS Library
Board of Education Work Study Meeting

div.div: Monday, April 27th, Hartford is transitioning to remote learning, which will provide student instruction either through paper pencil activities or online instruction. Click here to get more information!

The Hartford Public School District is seeking applicants for the current vacancy on the Board of Education. An individual will be appointed to fill the position through Dec 31, 2020 and will be replaced by the individual elected to the position (based upon the Nov 3, 2020 election results) on Jan 1, 2021. Interested persons must submit a letter expressing interest with their qualifications for the seat to the District Central Office no later than 2 p.m. on May 4, 2020. If you have any questions concerning the role of the board of education and the responsibilities of a board member, please contact Andrew Hubbard, Superintendent of Schools, at hubbarda@hpsmi.org or 269-621-7001.

img.alt: STAY HOME. STAY SAFE. SAVE LIVES. Thumbnail Image

h3.a: STAY HOME. STAY SAFE. SAVE LIVES.

div.div: Governor Whitmer signed the “Stay Home, Stay Safe” executive order. For at least the next three weeks, all Michigan businesses and operations must temporarily suspend in-person operations that are not necessary to sustain or protect life, and all Michiganders must stay in their homes unless they’re a part of that critical infrastructure workforce, engaged in an outdoor activity, or performing tasks necessary to the health and safety of themselves or their family, like going to the hospital or grocery store.

Monday-Friday meals will be provided at the following sites! From Noon till 1 PM -Redwood Elementary -Hartford Middle/ High School From 11:30 AM till noon -Van Auken Lake Store -Keeler Fire Department -Tom Smith Tractor -City Hall Parking Lot -Maple Hill Trailer Park Main Entrance From 12:15 PM till 12:45 -Applewood Trailer Park Main Entrance -Van Buren Fair Grounds - 681 Entrance -Corner of Lyttleton Ave and 66th St -Hartford Community Center Parking Lot -Corner of Pleasant and Vanderlyn
